snippet: Reports from the city’s major brokerage firms blame dwindling condominium inventory for a 12 percent decline in the fourth quarter.
abstract: New York City's major real estate brokerage firms are expected to report that while the Manhattan market closed out 2011 with prices relatively flat, sales volume for the fourth quarter was down by more than 12 percent from 2010; drop is mainly attributed to shrinking condominium inventory, with fewer new developments coming to market
lead_paragraph: Reports from the city’s major brokerage firms blame dwindling condominium inventory for a 12 percent decline in the fourth quarter.

headline.seo: Manhattan Real Estate Prices Are Steady, But Sales Drop
headline.main: Real Estate Prices Are Steady in Manhattan, but Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: Real Estate Prices Are Steady In Manhattan, but Sales Fall
